alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 12:46PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Forsyth and western Guilford Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 1246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Germanton, or near Winston-Salem, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Kernersville, Summerfield, Stokesdale, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Haw River State Park and Pfafftown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
